alert.note: Alert for Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN AND LIBERTY COUNTIES... At 522 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Fort Stewart, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Hinesville, Fort Stewart, and Flemington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<45 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
